item.name: Create a Device in the CDB
Delete a device from CDB Device List
All Devices: Show Running-config Devices Device
Dry Run Reverse: Getting back to current state if commit success
Remove SNMP Community String from Device
1. Create a DNS Server Configuration Template

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

request.description:
sample CLI to do the same:
devices template Standard_DNS_Servers
ned-id cisco-ios-cli-6.42
confi
ip name-server name-server-list 8.8.8.8
exit
exit
exit
ned-id cisco-nx-cli-5.13 config
ip name-server servers 8.8.8.8

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Authorization header generated by Postman.

body.raw:
<!--
cli for same config
conf
devices device ios0 apply-template template-name DNS_Server_Template_Junos_IOS
-->

<input>
	<template-name>DNS_Server_Template_Junos_IOS</template-name>
</input>

item.name: PATCH Create or Modify Device Groups

request.description:
Groups are useful for organizing your devices in a way
that makes sense to you.

Devices can be a member of more than one group,
and device groups can be nested.

CLI Equivalent

devices device-group campus-devices device-name [ ios0 nx0 ]
top
devices device-group backbone-devices device-name [ iosxr0 asa0 ]
top
devices device-group parent-group-all-devices device-group [ campus-devices backbone-devices ]
commit dry-run
commit dry-run outformat xml
top

request.description: This compliance report uses the device config template Standard_DNS_Servers to see if the device has a DNS server of 8.8.8.8, only for IOS devices. If non-IOS devices are applied, they are ignored.
